definition: to play with/to wield/to act (cool etc)/to display (a skill, one's temper etc)
gas/air/smell/weather/to make angry/to annoy/to get angry/vital energy/qi

sentences.english: It's really embarrassing when he acts up in public.
sentences.chinese: 他在外头耍脾气，真令我难为情。

sentences.english: One of the most common forms of acting out behavior is by being passive aggressive.
sentences.chinese: 最常见的耍脾气是消极对抗。

sentences.english: When sometimes your small kitty, sometimes plays the temperament.
sentences.chinese: 有时候当妳的小猫咪，有时耍脾气。

sentences.english: Don't be afraid of your child's tears or anger.
sentences.chinese: 不要害怕孩子的眼泪和耍脾气。

sentences.english: Be careful not to show your temper when dealing with the boss.
sentences.chinese: 今天和老板打交道的时候，小心点，别耍脾气。

sentences.english: Acting out is indirectly expressing feelings and emotions through behavior.
sentences.chinese: 耍脾气是用过行为间接地表达情绪。

definition: to be in a bad mood
to be difficult with sb/to provoke disagreement/at loggerheads/to fall out with
to make trouble without reason (idiom); to be deliberately provocative
to act like a spoiled child/to throw a tantrum/to act coquettishly
to grimace with displeasure/to pull a long face
to act in a fit of pique/to get in a huff/to be peeved
to catch fire/to ignite/to detonate/to get angry
lit. to climb all over sb/fig. to take advantage of sb's weakness
